definition: apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.english: Behind the tip of the A, behind the plateau of Mont -Saint-Jean, is the forest of Soignes.
sentences.chinese: 在A字的尖顶和圣约翰山高地后面的，是索瓦宁森林。

sentences.english: They wear white robes as well, and wear cone-shaped hats decorated with stars.
sentences.chinese: 他们也身着白袍，头戴装饰有星星的尖顶帽。

sentences.english: All around me the black fir-points stood upright and stock-still.
sentences.chinese: 我的周围，黝黑的枞树尖顶挺立着动也不动。

sentences.english: It was a church with a shuttered belfry and spire.
sentences.chinese: 那是一座有百叶窗的钟楼和尖顶的教堂。

sentences.english: They usually wear pointed hatsand fly around on broomsticks.
sentences.chinese: 他们通常戴着尖顶的帽子，骑在扫把上飞来飞去。

sentences.english: Awesome design. It looks like Burj al Alam if it had a spire .
sentences.chinese: 很棒的设计，它就像爱尔爱兰塔上加上了尖顶。

sentences.english: They usually wear pointed hats and fly around on broomsticks.
sentences.chinese: 他们通常戴着尖顶的帽子，骑在扫把上飞来飞去。

sentences.english: A fog lifted over the towering spires of St. Elizabeth’s Cathedral.
sentences.chinese: 圣伊丽莎白大教堂高塔尖顶处的雾气消散了。

sentences.english: With the pointed tip jutting out into the sea, it looks like an eagle standing on one leg.
sentences.chinese: 它的尖顶外伸入海，看起来像一只独角站立着的。

sentences.english: Drag onto the page, then right-click to show peaked roof or sump.
sentences.chinese: 拖到绘图页上，然后右击可显示尖顶或贮槽。

sentences.english: Walk on the zebra crossing step by step with rear foot tip against the front foot heel.
sentences.chinese: 每一步都后脚尖顶着前脚跟这样的走过斑马线。

sentences.english: The high-rising roof in southern China makes it easier for the rainwater drop.
sentences.chinese: 中国南方房子的尖顶可以让水很容易地流下去。

sentences.english: This is a square building with a single pyramid roof.
sentences.chinese: 这是一座攒尖顶的方形大殿。

definition: tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
